    • Method Detail

      • getAllUser

        public java.util.Set<AppUser> getAllUser()
        Returns all users registered with the bank database.
        Returns:
        a Set of AppUsers that have been registered and saved to the bank database

      • getUsersByRole

        public java.util.Set<AppUser> getUsersByRole(Role role)
        Returns all AppUsers who have the given Role.
        Parameters:
        role - the Role to search by.
        Returns:
        a Set of AppUsers that all have the given Role

      • getUsersById

        public java.util.Set<AppUser> getUsersById(int id)
        Returns all AppUsers who have the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the int id to search by.
        Returns:
        a Set of AppUsers that all have the given id. This should never be more than 1 user.

      • getUserById

        public AppUser getUserById(int id)
        Returns the first AppUser found with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the int id to search by
        Returns:
        the first AppUser found with the given id.

      • getUserByUsername

        public AppUser getUserByUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Returns the first AppUser found with the given username.
        Parameters:
        username - the String username to search by.
        Returns:
        the first AppUser found with the given username.

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password)
        This method authenticates a AppUser that already exists within the database. with the given username and password with the database. If a user already exists with the username and password or a user does not exist with the username and password or either username or password are either null or empty, then the method will not authenticate.
        Parameters:
        username - the String username to authenticate.
        password - the String password to authenticate.

      • register

        public void register(AppUser newUser)
        This method registers a new AppUser into the database.
        Parameters:
        newUser - the AppUser to store/register in the database.

      • updateUser

        public boolean updateUser(AppUser user)
        This method updates the records of a AppUser that exists on the database with the local record.
        Parameters:
        user - the AppUser to update.
        Returns:
        returns true if the update was successful, false otherwise.

      • deleteUserById

        public boolean deleteUserById(int id)
        This method deletes a AppUser with the given id from the the database, along with any records only pertinent to them.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the AppUser.
        Returns:
        returns true if the deletion was successful, false if otherwise. If there was no such user, returns true.

      • validateUserFields

        public boolean validateUserFields(AppUser user)
        Validates that the given AppUser and its fields are valid (not null or empty strings). Does not perform validation on id or Role fields.
        Parameters:
        user - the AppUser to validate.
        Returns:
        true if the AppUser is valid.

      • isUserValid

        public boolean isUserValid(AppUser user)
        Validates that the given AppUser and its fields are valid (not null or empty strings). Does not perform validation on id or Role fields.
        Parameters:
        user - the AppUser to validate.
        Returns:
        true if the AppUser is valid.
